summary: Feature request to add a default value (crypto.randomUUID()) to workflowId to reduce redundant code. Request was declined in favor of guiding users toward business-meaningful IDs instead of random IDs.
userImpact: Users who want to use random UUIDs for workflow IDs must manually import crypto and set the value each time.
proposedFix: Add crypto.randomUUID() as default value for workflowId parameter
workaround: Manually import crypto package and set workflowId to crypto.randomUUID() in application code
resolutionDetails: Rejected because users should use business-meaningful workflow IDs for production scenarios. Random UUIDs are discouraged to guide users toward better practices.
keyQuote: You should always use meaningful business IDs for workflow IDs in real world scenarios and the API should lead users in that direction.
